page.title: 10Sallet Hole Mine.
page.content: This modern mine was made following an eighteenth century drainage channel and now digs 350 feet deep under Longstone Edge, extracting fluorspar and associated minerals for processing at Cavendish Mill nearby. It employs a number of miners, most of whom come by car from outside the area. A new branch of the mine, with an entrance on the top of Longstone Edge, is now being developed. Drainage is a problem, especially in view of the toxicity of the slurry, and a drain and sump has been made along Coombs Dale and the neighbouring grass fenced off to avoid illness for cattle. Special arrangements for piping water are necessary for their needs.
